actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs.

committees.committee: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to amend the National Bank Act, to refund to the Comptroller of the currency funds held as successor to closed national bank receiverships and for other purposes.

summary.text: Title I: Amendments to the National Banking Laws - Makes changes with respect to the following: (1) the power of national banks to purchases, hold, and convey real estate; (2) the trust powers of national banks; and (3) the emergency restrictions on Federal Reserve banks. Title II: Termination of National Bank Closed Receivership Fund - Directs the Comptroller of the Currency to disburse the liquidating dividends from national banks closed on or before January 22, 1934, held by the Comptroller in the capacity as successor to receivers of those banks.

titles.title: A bill to amend the National Bank Act, to refund to the Comptroller of the currency funds held as successor to closed national bank receiverships and for other purposes.
